Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: michebu
Reviews.Content: Close to airport, railway & trolley lines; close to harbour; rooms are fairly decent; prefer the lino to carpet so nothing can be hiding in it; had some issues with 1st room and staff was quite nice about 2nd room (different staff member than when we check in or in the morning); fridge in room was nice especially in a motel without breakfast. Check-in staff was not very friendly and gave completely different story about airport shuttle than truth turned out to be in the morning; were told that they had a minivan and even talked to the driver (?) but in the morning it was the blue airport shuttles that serve the whole area, times and names were all mixed up compared to what we had signed up for, AM staff not helpful is solving the shuttle issue; shuttle has $5 charge/person-had understood it to be free, adds up when you're 14 people!! Didn't bother me and I knew the noise would be there, but if you haven't googled the motel location - it is pretty much at the end of the runway so NOT for light sleepers! and the trolley and railway lines run behind the motel as well. Quiet time is from about midnight or 1- 6:30 am? I personally loved watching the planes come in. For a motel that offers an airport shuttle (or do they?), they should have a public access computer to print boarding passes in my opinion. (A question I forgot to ask when booking.) Apparently we could have given the information to the manager and he would have done that. NOT something I'm comfortable with - I want to be there to do my own check in and baggage payments at the same time. Free Wifi didn't want to work in the 1st room but once we switched rooms, worked perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Planes 40 feet above you!”
Reviews.Author: SoLaras
Reviews.Content: This motel proximity to the airport is definitely the downside to it. Planes are landing non stop at proximities of 40 feet or so! Add the street noise to the mix and you have a very noisy place. The rooms are big but have a bare bone feeling to them. The floors are vinyl instead if carpeted giving them a very cheap feeling. Parties go on and the Premises and it seems to be allowed by management. On the plus side the hotel offers free wiFi, cable, free parking and its located close to downtown. I paid $44 for a night, I guess if I had to I would stay there again but it wouldnt be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like sleeping on a runway”
Reviews.Author: Osakasenba
Reviews.Content: Everything is OK with the motel: staff, room quality, bath-room, but the noise from airplanes flying 50 meters above is incredible!!! Add to it a railway behind the motel... If you are very tired or have to get up rather early or don't have another option - then the place is OK. It's close to the Maritime Museum and about 25 minutes walk from Gaslamp street.

Reviews.Title: “Here By Happy Accident”
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum
Reviews.Content: Motel 6's website stupidly lets you book into the sister property (Downtown) with a child in tow, even though the rooms don't have the ability to put them up. So, we ended up here by default as they do have enough room for couples with children. At first we were alarmed by the reviews before coming here, but actually it's much better than expected and I'm really glad we were forced to move. We had a massive, newly refurbished room with a fridge. It was also cheaper than Downtown and had free Wi-Fi too. Granted, it's next to a strip club, railway line and beneath the flight path of the airport (so close you can almost see the passenger's faces) but we weren't bothered. Never saw any trouble from the strip club (it's far away enough next door and you can't see it from your room) and the planes landing was very exciting. I personally loved being so close to an airport and I'm not even a plane spotter! Most flights have landed by around 10.30-11pm, so noise isn't really an issue from the airport. The departures runway is away from the property, so early morning noise didn't really happen for us. You might get train horns sounding if you're unlucky until about 1am, but that's about it. We didn't use public transport and drove to most places. In particular I would recommend a trip to 'Old Town', which is about 5-10 minutes up the road. We ate out here and loved every minute of it - the ambience is incredible. This isn't as bad as other reviews make out we have stayed in far worse places.

Reviews.Title: “cheap, decent, airport noise”
Reviews.Author: thefatneck
Reviews.Content: $71 for one person on a Saturday night, Outdated but clean. Ignore the snobs reviews. I would rate this on the lower end of the Motel 6 motels I have stayed at. Walk to the bay, shops, downtown. Feels pretty safe here.

Reviews.Title: “So sorry I didn't check reviews first”
Reviews.Author: Orangeygreen
Reviews.Content: Very noisy. They recently replaced all the carpeting with laminate and you could hear EVERY footstep overhead. Unfortunately the people upstairs paced through the night. Watching the planes come in was like watching a horror movie of a plane crash. Every time one came in I got the urge to run.

Reviews.Title: “Planes passing over your bed!”
Reviews.Author: Sotong164
Reviews.Content: We were sent to this place by the Motel 6 Downtown that couldn't accomodate a party of 3. We wanted to stay there for 2 nights. This Motel 6 is located right below the landing strip of San Diego Airport and it sometimes felt like the planes were passing through your bedroom. On top of that you have the railway track behind the Hotel and each train running past blowed the horn and last but not least there is fairly heavy car traffic passing through Pacific Highway which is right in front of the Motel. So if you cannot sleep in noisy spots - stay away!! The rooms were standard and clean. The Staff was as friendly as necessary but seemed to be rather bored. There was no breakfast and the coffee wasn't very good either. So all in all we survived it but definitely not a place to recommend to your friends.

Reviews.Title: “Plane spotters will love this....”
Reviews.Author: beligerent_ghoul
Reviews.Content: When they said this hotel was close to the airport I didn't realise they meant under the flight path within a stones throw of the airport! Let's get a few things straight... Yes you are going to see and hear planes, but they are not flying all night, intact around 11 they stop until about 7:30, so it does not affect sleep! Also there are trains, but they are similar timescale! Motel clean, rooms large, plenty of parking! Short drive to gaslamp and Balboa! We were her for four nights! No problems!

Reviews.Title: “New favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: maria9091
Reviews.Content: I usually stay over at the Marina Inn and suites but ended up booking at this location instead. the room was great and smelled clean too. it was affordable, comfortable and i enjoyed every minute of it. This is my new favorite hotel. We could see the planes landing from our room!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE DIRTY HOTEL FOR THE PRICE ONE NIGHT RIP OFF $62.00”
Reviews.Author: J1HOLMES
Reviews.Content: The worst motel 6 I ever stayed in. Very dirty and carpet felt like a slug of dirt. I felt I got ripped off for $62.00 I should have slept in my car, but I needed a clean bed, which the sheets were thin and cover was dirty. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, unless the only hotel that is avaible in the city of san Diego.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay for..”
Reviews.Author: JillyAltrincham
Reviews.Content: is what you get. Just be prepared for planes, they come down so close it looks like they are going to land on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Not at the Airport, on the landing path for jumbo jets”
Reviews.Author: gelcoatjohnny
Reviews.Content: Yes, this Motel 6 is located right next to a strip club and on the landing path for jumbo jets. I have never seen anything like this. The jets came so close to the motel that there were people in the parking lot taking photos of the jets as they descended over the motel approaching the airport. Whoever said you could hardly hear the noise once you closed your door must be deaf. There is no way to drown out the sound of a Southwest Airlines or American Airlines flight that is so close to your room you can see the pilot in the cockpit. The place is shabby, just plain shabby. Evevrything is old and dirty and there are no amenities whatsoever. I wrote the corporate headquarters and they informed me that every property is independently owned so basically no one wants to take any responsibility. Furthermore they said I should have known planes would be flying overhead since it is advertised as an airport location. There are much better places to staty in San Diego that are close to the airport but not right on the landing path. On a subsequent stay we used Good Nite inn and although that location was also next to a strip club (seems like popular entertainment in San Diego) the hotel was clean, safe, comfortable and the staff was knowledgable and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “This place was just plain icky”
Reviews.Author: MyLatestJourney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a Motel 6 before in a different part of the country. I understand that they are a no-frills value brand, but what I recalled of my (admittedly long ago) prior experience was that the room was clean and comfortable. Not so here. I arrived around 11 pm and the office was locked. I had to use a "teller window" to check-in. This did not inspire confidence in the safety of the motel. Walking in the room, my overall impression was that it was "icky." The carpets didn't look clean. The room did not smell particularly fresh. There was no alarm clock. The bedspread was old and had a burn hole on the underside. The pillows were obviously lumpy and uneven under the bedspread. The sheets and blanket were incredibly thin. I didn't feel like there was enough separation between me and the mattress pad. I didn't know if I would be warm enough under the sheet and blanket and I didn't want to use the bedspread unless absolutely necessary. I wasn't confident it was totally clean. The pillows were too big for the pillowcases they were stuffed into. One was too thick for me to rest my head onto comfortably, and both were very lumpy. The mattress was uncomfortably hard. I wasn't sure I would be able to sleep on it, never mind the planes frequently flying not far overhead and the trollies honking by. The bathroom was OK, but a hair dryer would have been nice, and the water pressure was not very good. Granted, the room was relatively cheap for the at $70 for the night, but I expected it to be clean and comfortable at a minimum. It was neither, and I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sleaziest motel I have ever been!”
Reviews.Author: Seacell
Reviews.Content: Do you know that this hotel is right beside a strip bar? I wouldn't even use the term "gentleman's club" because there is nothing gentlemanly with the men who patronize such an establishment. I looked in horror as we saw the neon sign with the silhouette of a naked lady as we drove in. If only we could get a refund, we would have not stayed that night. For practicality's sake, we stayed and it was just one disaster after another. The carpet was so dirty it turned our socks/feet black! There were disgusting stains on it as well. The sheets were old and thin. The only chair in the room was broken. The pizza was overpriced (we ordered from the same chain in the next hotel we stood in since we jetted out of that place as soon as we could the next morning and found that the prices were cheaper there). For a room as disgusting as this, it was severely overpriced at $75. You could hear planes soar above the hotel as they landed. I was on a summer road trip with my husband and two boys ages one and five so it was an extremely horrible experience to stay in this hotel. Half the time, I was expecting to see something inappropriate especially for my kids whom we kept in the room at all times and we didn't allow them to look out the window. Call me paranoid/judgmental but I felt that this hotel was as filthy as the place beside it and I wonder what kind of "business" goes on in the other rooms. Definitely not the hotel you would choose if you're on a family trip and if you care about morality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalC8
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. I was pretty apprensive at the beginning but we ended up loving this place. It's a great deal if you want to be near downtown SD. Yes, the planes arriviing at SD airport fly right over the hotel but honestly, if you close your door, you can barely notice the noise. Beds were comfy, shower was great and we even had a mini-fridge in our room. I'm one who feels that paying $100+ for a bed and a shower is ridiculous and am a frequent Motel 6 user and this is one of the better ones that I have stayed it (WAY better than the Hotel Circle location by far!). We came in town to see the Dodgers kick some Padres butt (which they did) and I wasn't looking for a places with room service or valet parking. I'd rather spend my money on fun!! So if you are the type like this, don't be afraid - it's not as bad as some of these other people say. **FREE Wi-FI!!**

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 Airport San Diego”
Reviews.Author: nancy_ont
Reviews.Content: One word describes this dump. Disgusting. We stayed Fri, May 15, 2009. We landed at 11:30 p.m. and found this place from an advertisement at the airport. There was mold on the pillows and the stale stench of smoke in the room. We were dropped off by shuttle bus which we thought was free, then had to pay the hotel $10.00 for the service. Next morning we took a taxi to the airport to pick up our rental car and the cab ride was $4.80?? half the price of the shuttle bus. What a rip off. The room was not clean and we did not bother to shower the next morning for fear of picking something up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tykirah10
Reviews.Content: This is a great , cheap location to stay if you are going on a cruise. We were 5 minutes from the airport and 5 minutes from the cruise terminal. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. There were 15 in our group and we arrived early before the cruise and after. Although check-in wasn't until 3 p.m. they made every effort to get us in the rooms as soon as they were finished cleaning them. We were all in by 12:30. It is 3 blocks to the train that loops around the city. Not fancy, but clean, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chep and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Zammit
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay for the night Motel 6 is a good option. Rooms were comfortable but be reminded this is no ritz you get what you pay for and we were very happy. The planes are not a problem as they stop at night and it is quite spectacular wathcing them come in to land. Close to Balboa park and the ZOO wich is what we were here for. Only a 5 min drive to both.

Reviews.Title: “Plain but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jonbrak1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in July 2007 and found the motel to be perfectly acceptable. The airport noise was only noticeable during the dayâ€”it was actually a bit exciting while using the pool to see the incoming planes flying so low!â€”the nights were perfectly silent and there wasnâ€™t noise from other rooms. The room was VERY plainâ€”no artwork on the walls whatsoever, no shampoo, no ironing board/iron or blow dryer included. It was easy to check out an iron and tabletop ironing board, but tricky to use because of the roomâ€™s lack of electrical outlets. There was one in the bathroom, one behind the roomâ€™s desk, which was being used by the television and mini-refrigerator, and one oddly placed above the light switch next to the room door. For anyone traveling with a laptop, I would suggest bringing an outlet extender unless you donâ€™t mind not using the TV or fridge. The wi-fi worked great. The towels are thin and not terribly comfortable to use, but got the job done. There are no towels at the pool, so you might want to ask for a couple of extras for your room if you plan to go swimming. The pool isnâ€™t huge, but does go to eight feet deep and was a very comfortable temperature. There are some large palm trees nearby that drop debris in the pool, but the maintenance staff was quick to skim the pool and were very friendly. Check-in and check-out were totally painless and fast and the front desk staff was very pleasant. My only problem with any of the staff was with housekeeping, who kept turning off the A/C whenever they cleaned the room. Returning to the room at the end of a long day of sightseeing wasnâ€™t as comfortable as it couldâ€™ve been, but the A/C was strong enough that it cooled the room down in 20-30 minutes, so the discomfort wasnâ€™t long lasting. The motel is definitely worth the money and I wouldnâ€™t have any problems staying there again. Itâ€™s not for those who love to be pampered, but for sightseers who are on the go all day and just looking for a place to relax and crash, itâ€™s great.

Reviews.Title: “Quite acceptable”
Reviews.Author: alexiusp
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this Motel6 even after reading all the reviews, mainly because it was one of the cheapest that was closest to San Diego downtown and Balboa Park. Yes, there is a lot of airplane noise, but (a) it was true that planes don't fly late at night, (b) we were always dead tired that we don't hear anything at all after touring. Parking can be a little tight, but it wasn't a problem. We got a 2-queen beds room, which is fairly spacious. The usual motel amenities include the TV and a fridge (not listed on their website). Room (especially the bathroom) appeared to be either renovated or repainted. The only problem was that they only give a bar of soap (i.e. no shampoo). As standard, they had 2 towel sets; however, you can get more towels (we have 2 small kids as well) from the front desk. They supply morning coffee and tea at the front desk from 6-10am. But the best thing about this motel is that it is a 5 min drive from downtown and about 6 mins from Balboa Park. The downside of this motel is that it doesn't have any restaurants nearby (within walking distance). While this is not an issue for lunch or dinner, it may bug those who want to have a full breakfast before touring.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: macman2
Reviews.Content: The good news is that if you read the reviews, you know how to prepare and you can't touch the price. As noted, the motel sits on the airplane path and also next to a train. The room was basic, but clean and it is great for those who need to catch an early flight. Our room had some minor problems - it had a slight perfume odor which we adjusted to and it was missing the shampoo. Check in was easy and the staff were helpful. My strong advice is to bring ear plugs and shampoo and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...in the land path though”
Reviews.Author: SpencerC11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in July. The hotel is not bad if you're looking for a place to sleep. There is nothing special about this property unless you're very interested in commercial aviation. If you are, you should stay here. The hotel is directly in line with the landing path of the airport. It can be very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Ok If You Are Interested in Airplanes!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. However, the biggest draw back was the airplane noise. This motel sits on the landing flight path. Every 3 minutes huge jets would fly over -- VERY LOUD. You can see the people in the planes so that is CLOSE! The plane noise did subside after 11 p.m. Ok if you are planning on going to the airport the next day! Not close to the Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “You have got to be Nuts!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Diego for an overnight layover after a 12 hour flight. Figured i just needed a bed to rest my head someplace near the airport. My past experiences at Travelodge have been good (cheap clean, good value) so i figured this would be perfect. Their on-line website made it look nice...boy was i in for a shock. As i arrived after 9pm i was forced to endure a check-in thru a small "security" window on the side of the office. My room was on the second level in a darkend part of the lot (scary). When i opened the door i almost fainted from the smell. Apparently the carpet had been "cleaned" and the room had not been properly aired out. Management said no other rooms available...take it or leave it...nice. So i had to endure a wet carpet and noxious odors for the night, but having looked around the room upon entry i decided to sleep in my clothes: -the A/C was rusty and made a loud clunking noise -paint was peeling on the walls -bathroom shower stall had cracked tiles -rust stains around the bathroom fixtures -worst of all, there were bugs on the sink. Somehow I managed to make it thru the night. I caught the first shuttle out the next morning. While waiting for the shuttle I was priviliged enough to sample the free continental breakfast...a packaged danish, watery OJ and/or instant coffee. In a nutshell...you'd have to be nuts...pay the extra $ and stay somplace nicer. Pros: Free shuttle (via Cloud 9 - a separate transportation company) Cons: Too many to list...see above.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD but extremely convenient”
Reviews.Author: funnychap24
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here last month. Extremely convenient for airport. (Make sure you mention that you need free shuttle & at what time when checking in) Staff at desk was very friendly! Planes fly RIGHT NEXT to hotel since runway is practically across the street. If you live on a busy street like I do, noise won't bother you. If you're used to quiet...maybe this isn't the place for you. Would stay again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy, but handy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Far too noisy with planes virtually landing on the building and trains as good as driving through the room. However, the noise seemed to die down when we went to bed and the room was clean. Maybe we were lucky, compared to the previous two reviews. The airport shuttle worked fine too and it was next door to our rental car place. However, I would stay a bit further from the airport next time and pay for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Most awful place I have ever stayed. We were close to everything, especially MCRD, where my son was graduating from boot camp. But the dirty socks, the unchanged sheets, the filthy bathrooms. I do not get it at all. We were there in August 2003, from the other review, it has not changed at all!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Exp_Biz_Traveler
Reviews.Content: (Stayed early December 2003) What a shame. It is two blocks from light rail, close to the cruise center, and cheap -- all the makings of a perfect place to stay. You really need to avoid this one at all costs. Our non-smoking room smelled like smoke. The bathroom floor was so dirty it turned our socks black. The carpet was so filthy it turned our spare socks brownish-yellow. There were yellow stains on the mattress and what looked and smelled like a pet stain in the corner by the closet. Those are the things under management's control. Not under management's control is the fact the hotel is literally across the street from the landing pad for the airport and backed up against both the light rail and freight train tracks. The airplane noise is deafening at all hours. This hotel won a quality award from their chain a while back, but it certainly doesn't deserve it now. Management was rude and would not even return calls from our travel agent. Luckily, our agent processed the refund independently after almost four months of trying to contact management.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 - San Diego Airport/Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 2353 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92101 (Formerly Econo Lodge)
